Package src

Class Map

  • java.lang.Object
    • src.Map
  • public class Map
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to store the information of a map. Also, it provides all the necessary functions to get information about the map, changing it or doing a step on the map.

      • Map

        public Map​(Map mapToCopy,
           boolean phaseOne)
        Copy constructor. Copy the given Map. Apart from the Arrow arrays it's a deep copy
        Parameters:
        mapToCopy - map to copy
        phaseOne - phase the map is in

        Prints Infos, Map and Transitions in a formatted way to the outputs
        Overrides:

      • toString_Server

        public java.lang.String toString_Server​(java.util.ArrayList<int[]> everyPossibleMove)
        Returns a map in a style that can be compared to the server output
        Parameters:
        everyPossibleMove - List of int[] (x, y, info) that specify the possible positions a stone can be placed
        Returns:
        formatted string

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString​(java.util.List<int[]> everyPossibleMove,
                                 boolean showTransitions,
                                 boolean useColors)
        Advanced toString() Method. It returns the map in a formatted String that can be changed by the parameters.
        Parameters:
        everyPossibleMove - List of int[] (x, y, info) that specify the possible positions a stone can be placed
        showTransitions - boolean if the transitions should be appended.
        useColors - boolean if the returned string should have color information in it to print it.
        Returns:
        formatted string

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString​(java.util.List<int[]> everyPossibleMove,
                                 boolean showTransitions,
                                 java.util.ArrayList<Position> positionsToMark)
        This Method returns the map in a formatted String. It shows all the possible routes you could go from the specified Positions by the positionsToMark List
        Parameters:
        everyPossibleMove - List of int[] (x, y, info) that specify the possible positions a stone can be placed
        showTransitions - boolean if the transitions should be appended.
        positionsToMark - List of Position objects that specify which positions should be marked.
        Returns:
        formatted string

      • toString

        public static java.lang.String toString​(java.lang.String mapAsString,
                                        boolean useColors)
        This method is used when the Client compares it's output to the one of the server. It formats the output of the Server in a way that it can be compared to the Client's output.
        Parameters:
        mapAsString - The output of the Server in a string
        useColors - Boolean if colors should be used
        Returns:
        formatted String

        public java.util.ArrayList<int[]> getValidMovesByArrows​(Heuristic heuristic)

        Parameters:
        heuristic - heuristic by which it gets evaluated if an overwrite-move should be made.
        Returns:
        List of all the possible Positions the player can move to

        Parameters:

      • Inversion

        public void Inversion()
        The colors of all players are shifted by one. This is done so that the Stones of player 2 are now the ones of player 1

        public int nextPlayer()
        sets the player currently playing to the next one. Regards only the disqualified players and not if the player can make a move
        Returns:
        returns the number of skipped players

        Returns:

        Returns:

        Returns:

        public Position checkOverwriteMovesTheOtherWay()

        Returns:
        true if everything is right and false otherwise

      • doAStep

        public java.lang.Integer doAStep​(Position pos,
                                 int r)
        By calling this method you can simulate a step on the map. This step is taken from the specified position in the specified direction. The position that was given the method contains afterwards the new position after the step
        Parameters:
        pos - Position to do the step from
        r - direction in which to go
        Returns:
        Integer value which direction you are now facing or null if the step wasn't possible

      • updateMapWithMove

        public static void updateMapWithMove​(Position posToSetKeystone,
                                     int additionalInfo,
                                     int moveOfPlayer,
                                     Map map,
                                     boolean printOn)
        This method simulates a move. The given map is updated in regard to the position the stone was set to.
        Parameters:
        posToSetKeystone - Position the keystone was set to
        additionalInfo - Additional information that might be needed (1-9 for a choice-move; 20, 21 for a bonus move)
        moveOfPlayer - player number of the player that made the move
        map - Map that is updated
        printOn - boolean that specifies if the function should print an output

      • updateMapAfterBombingBFS

        public static void updateMapAfterBombingBFS​(int x,
                                            int y,
                                            int moveOfPlayer,
                                            Map map)
        Updates Map by breadth-first search.
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate where the bomb was set.
        y - y coordinate where the bomb was set.
        moveOfPlayer - the player number of the player that set the bomb.
        map - the map on which the bomb move should be made.

      • colorMap

        public static void colorMap​(Position pos,
                            Map map)
        colors the map when the keystone is placed at the specified position
        Parameters:
        pos - position where the keystone is placed
        map - the map on which it is placed on

      • getValidMoves

        public static java.util.ArrayList<int[]> getValidMoves​(Map map,
                                                       boolean timed,
                                                       boolean printOn,
                                                       boolean serverLog,
                                                       long upperTimeLimit,
                                                       Heuristic heuristic)
                                                throws ExceptionWithMove
        returns the possible moves on the specified map for the current player
        Parameters:
        map - Map that possible moves are calculated on
        timed - boolean if there is a time limit
        printOn - boolean if the method should print information
        serverLog - boolean if only the necessary information should be printed
        upperTimeLimit - if timed is enabled this is the time limit the method needs to consider
        heuristic - heuristic to evaluate if overwrite moves should be made
        Returns:
        List of possible Moves. The moves are specified in an int[] as (x,y,info)
        Throws:
        ExceptionWithMove - if the time is over this exception is thrown. It contains a move that can be made

      • getPositionsToSetABomb

        public static java.util.ArrayList<int[]> getPositionsToSetABomb​(Map map)
        returns the possible bomb moves on the specified map for the current player
        Parameters:
        map - Map that possible moves are calculated on
        Returns:
        List of possible Moves. The moves are specified in an int[] as (x,y,info)

      • checkIfMoveIsPossible

        public static boolean checkIfMoveIsPossible​(Position pos,
                                            java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> directions,
                                            Map map)
        goes in every specified direction to check if it's possible to set a keystone at the specified position
        Parameters:
        pos - pos the keystone would be placed
        directions - directions it needs to check
        map - the map the check takes place on
        Returns:
        returns true if the move is possible and false otherwise

      • getFieldsByOwnColor

        public static java.util.ArrayList<int[]> getFieldsByOwnColor​(Map map,
                                                             boolean timed,
                                                             boolean printOn,
                                                             boolean serverLog,
                                                             long upperTimeLimit,
                                                             Heuristic heuristic)
                                                      throws ExceptionWithMove
        returns the possible moves on the specified map for the current player. This is done by using the "By own color" Method
        Parameters:
        map - Map that possible moves are calculated on
        timed - boolean if there is a time limit
        printOn - boolean if the method should print information
        serverLog - boolean if only the necessary information should be printed
        upperTimeLimit - if timed is enabled this is the time limit the method needs to consider
        heuristic - heuristic to evaluate if overwrite moves should be made
        Returns:
        List of possible Moves. The moves are specified in an int[] as (x,y,info)
        Throws:
        ExceptionWithMove - if the time is over this exception is thrown. It contains a move that can be made

      • getStoneCountAfterMove

        public static double getStoneCountAfterMove​(Map map,
                                            int playerNr,
                                            int[] posToMoveTo)
        This method calculates the stone count after a move was made. This is used by MCTS
        Parameters:
        map - Map that value is calculated on
        playerNr - number of the player that would make the move
        posToMoveTo - position the player would place the stone
        Returns:
        double that represents the relation between the own stones and the enemy ones

      • getCountOfMovesForPlayer

        public static int getCountOfMovesForPlayer​(Map map,
                                           boolean timed,
                                           long upperTimeLimit)
                                    throws ExceptionWithMove
        This method returns the count of moves the current player can make
        Parameters:
        map - Map on which that is calculated
        timed - boolean if the method is times
        upperTimeLimit - if timed is enabled this is the time limit the method needs to consider
        Returns:
        count of moves the current player can make
        Throws:
        ExceptionWithMove - throws exception when the time is up.
